result.execSummary:
The defendant Sammy Lee Hicks was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Sammy Lee Hicks is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Sammy Lee Hicks was found guilty of Theft-Business Setting-Special Facts [Modifiers: as a Party to a Crime, Penalties for Felonies-Class "H" Felony], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(b).
  • Sammy Lee Hicks was found guilty of Theft-Business Setting-Special Facts [Modifiers: as a Party to a Crime, Penalties for Felonies-Class "H" Felony], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Court dismisses Counts 1 through 14 and Count 17.
Defendant to report to Probation today October 27, 2016.

 
In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

PPA reinstated after DE made May's pymt 3 wks late. DE pd July's pymt 19 days late, but is now current. DE to continue paying $225/mo comm 9/10/20. DE will be mailed an amended PPA advising him that pymts are due on time ea mo or a FTP WA will be issued along w/add'l fees. jaf

DE's case reviewed. DNA surcharge & court costs amended to $0 on this date. DE had pd DOC in full for these balances & COC has been PIF by DOC for costs & surcharges only. jaf
DE to continue making pymts for REST until PIF. REST is J/S w/15CF545 & that DE is still on ES. REST to be modified to reflect co-def's pymts. jaf

A woman called on behalf of the DE asking what the pymt options are to pay in person stating the DE lost his Pymt Plan Agmt. She was given the pymt options & advised they can also pay online or by ph, but she stated they'd rather pay in person b/c of the service fees. She was reminded to bring the case # when making pymts. jaf
DE mailed an amended copy of his Pymt Plan Agmt on this date. Total reflects all balances taken back from DOC in order to take restitution back. jaf
DE appeared. DE to pay $225/mo comm 2/10/2020.  $15 PPF added. DE signed PPA. jaf
Restitution. eif

10:28 AM  Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: S Lundmark, Clerk: A Anderson, ADA:  Alexis S. Mckinley,  DF ATTY:  Steven J Meshbesher,  DF: Sammy Lee Hicks appeared.  Agent Allen Matheus in court for DOC.  Court notes this is a continued hearing regarding probationary status.  DA Nieskes asks the court to extend DE's supervision for lack of payment.  Atty Meshbesher makes statement and asks the court to convert to a civil judment and discharge from probation.  DA Nieskes makes statement and asks the court to review the transcript from the sentencing hearing.  Agent Matheus makes statement.  Court questions DE. DE makes statement regarding his financial situation.  Court converts balance of restitution to a civil judgment and orders DE to pay $225/mo beginning 2/1/20 to the Clerk of Court Office.  DE's probation is terminated at this time.
Rec'd from DOC. Restitution Due: $65,896.77. Discharge Date 10/27/2019. Court notes court extended Probation for 90 Days. km

Court reviews file and status of restitution. DA Nieskes updates the Court. DA Nieskes requests a 2 year extension of probation. Court questions DE. DE would like to have his atty present. Court extends probation for 90 days to allow for DE to hire an atty. Court will reset.  Probation review hearing scheduled for December 17, 2019 at 10:15 am.

I called DOC cashier's unit and I was advised that the def paid court costs on 9-25-19. DOC stated that we will be receiving circuirt court fees in the amount of $352.00 for the balance of $176.00 for each count. I advised DOC that the def still owes restitution. DOC stated that per the last assessment report they received in 2016 it showed restitution was paid in full.  I explained to her that we generated another assessment report but it wasn't forwarded to DOC. I emailed and sent the 1-31-17 assessment report to DOC. I emailed and electronically sent the 11-7-16 restitution order to DOC cashier's unit.  mw

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. AAG Amber L Hahn DF ATTY: Steven J Meshbesher DF: Sammy Lee Hicks appeared. Case called at 10:48. Court reviews PSI. Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights on each count. Atty. Meshbesher clarifies the PSI. Court questions DE about his plea of guilt. DE maintains his plea of guilt to Ct 15, and Ct 16. Court finds DE freely, coluntarily and knowingly maintains his pleas to the charge. ADA Hahn would like to clarify an item on the PSI. ADA Hahn argues. Ex. #1, Ex. #2 O/R to be sealed in the court minutes. K. Borst makes a statement. Atty. Meshbesher would like DE son and daughter to make a statement. Atty. Meshbesher argues. Atty. give the court a check for $12,500 made out to St. Croix County Clerk of Court. DE makes statement. 

Court orders sentence W/H
On Ct. 15
3 years probation with conditions:
6 months jail as condition time STAYED. 
  if imposed Court authorizes huber for family care and employment.
- Costs of $268.00
- Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge of $250.00
- DE shall have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Mark W. or his guardian.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person. 
- DE to pay the balance of restitution joint and several with June Hicks.
- 120 hours of community service
- DE to participate in a victim empathy panel 
- Any other programming recommended by the agent. 

On Ct. 16  Court orders sentence W/H
3 years probation with same conditions as Ct. 15.
Probation is concurrent without prejudice to consecutive sentencing in the event of Probation revocation. 
- Costs of $268.00
- Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge $250.00.

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson.ADA:  Amber L Hahn   DF ATTY:  Steven J Meshbesher   DF:  Sammy Lee Hicks appeared. Case called at 11:04. Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads G to Ct15, 16 in 14CF546 . DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 15, 16  in 14CF546. On motion of the State without objecton, Crt dismisses with prejudice Ct 1-14, 17 in 14CF546. Court orders a PSI. Atty's to see JA for scheduling 60 days out. Bond continues.

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA: Amber L Hahn DF ATTY: Allan Hart Caplan DF: June Marie Hicks appeared. DF: Sammy Lee Hicks. Case called at 2:37. Includes 14CF545, 14CF546. In 14CF545 Court informs DE of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading.  NG to all counts.  Waives speedy trial. In 14CF546 Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading.  NG on all counts.  Waives speedy trial. Discovery to be provided in the next 30 days. Discovery has been provided. ADA Hahn responds and requests the DE to continue to appear in person. Court orders the DE to appear for next hearing in person. Atty. Caplan may appear by phone for the next hearing.Bonds continue in form and amount.  Status conference scheduled for August 13, 2015 at 11:00 am.
Arraignment on June 8, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

**AMENDED**

Prior to leaving the courthouse, report to St Croix County Jail for mugshots and fingerprints.

-It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Mark W. or his current guardian.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.
- DE not to travel out of the US without permission of the court. 

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA:  Amber L Hahn DF ATTY: Allan Hart Caplan DF: Sammy Lee Hicks did not appear DF: June Marie Hicks did not appear. Case called at 9:31 scheduled for 9:00.   Includes 14CF545, 14CF546. Court takes judicial notice of the DE addresses. ADA Hahn requests a warrant for both parties. Court issues a warrant for both parties. Case recalled at 9:36. Atty. Caplan updates the court. ADA Hahn requests Investigator Drost as the designated court officer. Court quashes warrants and authorizes Investigator Drost as court officer. S/T S. Jansma. Direct by ADA Hahn. Ex. #1 Mr. Weckworths income. Ex. #2 Pie chart of Ex. #1. Ex. #3 listing of all of checks listed on the pie chart. Ex. #4 listing of checks.EX#1-#4 O/R subject to cross. Cross by Atty. Hicks. Redirect by ADA Hahn. Recross by Atty. Caplan. S/T Investigator C. Drost. Direct by ADA Hahn. Investigator Drost identifies both DE in court. Ex#5. 15 pages report of Mr. Weckworth's expenses. Ex#6 Sams club receipts. Ex.#5 and #6 O/R. Cross by Atty. Caplan. ADA Hahn requests the court to take judicial notice of 05GN41 and WIsconsin statute 54.19. Court will take judicial notice of both.  ADA Hahn argues. Atty. Caplan argues. Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed in both cases 14CF545 and 14CF546 and the DE's probably committed that felony and binds both DE over for trial. ADA Hahn requestst to be heard on bond. Court takes judicial notice of 13CV118.  Arraignment scheduled for June 8, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
